summary: This document is a compilation of property records related to the sale of 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY from Nine East 71st Street Corporation to Maple, Inc. in December 2011, with Jeffrey Epstein signing as President of the seller corporation. It also includes a later court docket from 2019 showing the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein for sex trafficking and conspiracy. This document is a collection of court filings and property records related to Jeffrey Epstein's 2019 criminal case and associated properties. It includes an order admitting attorney Martin G. Weinberg pro hac vice as co-counsel for Epstein, and various property liens and violations associated with Epstein-linked entities and his New York mansion.

events.title: Sale of 9 East 71st Street

events.title: Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A sealed indictment is filed against Jeffrey Epstein for sex trafficking and conspiracy.

events.title: Initial Appearance and Arraignment
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein appears before Magistrate Judge Henry B. Pitman, pleads not guilty, and is detained pending a bail hearing.

events.title: Bail Hearing
events.description: A bail hearing is held before Judge Richard M. Berman, with arguments from defense and prosecution.

events.title: Lis Pendens Filed for Forfeiture
events.description: A lis pendens (notice of pending legal action) was filed by the United States against Jeffrey Epstein's property at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, with the nature of action listed as 'FORFEITURE'.

events.title: Order for Pro Hac Vice Admission
events.description: Judge Richard M. Berman granted the motion for attorney Martin G. Weinberg to be admitted pro hac vice as co-counsel for Jeffrey Epstein in criminal case 19 Cr 490.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein, as President of Nine East 71st Street Corporation, sold the property at 9 East 71st Street, Manhattan, to Maple, Inc., a US Virgin Islands corporation, for $10.00 on December 23, 2011.
The property at 9 East 71st Street is located within the Upper East Side Historic District, designated in 1981.
In July 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was indicted on federal charges of sex trafficking and conspiracy in the Southern District of New York.
Epstein was represented by a team of defense attorneys including Marc Allan Fernich, Martin Gary Weinberg, and Reid Weingarten.
The 2019 criminal docket shows extensive pretrial litigation, including a bail hearing and motions regarding pretrial release and sealing of documents.
The United States filed a lis pendens for forfeiture against Jeffrey Epstein's property at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY on July 11, 2019, as part of criminal case 19 Cr 490.
Attorney Martin G. Weinberg was formally admitted pro hac vice as co-counsel for Jeffrey Epstein on July 15, 2019, by order of Judge Richard M. Berman.

Multiple property records and liens are associated with entities containing 'Maple' in their name (e.g., Maple Made Properties Inc., Mapleshade Properties Inc.), all linked to the same Brooklyn address (847 Livonia Ave), suggesting a network of Epstein-associated holding companies.

The document shows a history of mechanics liens and violations (ECB, parking, transit) against these Maple-named entities and the corporation that owned Epstein's mansion, indicating ongoing property management and legal issues.
The property at 9 East 71st Street was held by the 'Nine East 71st Street Corporation', which faced mechanics liens in the early 1990s.
